page.title: 14 - TOURISM
page.content: There are two watermills at Burton Mill and Coultershaw. The former, built in 1784, is being restored by West Sussex County Council and is in commercial use. The public may visit on certain days of the week. At the latter site is an old beam pump engine which used to supply water to Petworth. There was also a mill here but it was burnt down in recent years. The site is now a listed monument open to the public during summer weekends. Fishing permits are available for the river Rother and for Burton Mill pond. Ramblers are well provided with foot and bridle paths, and in summer a special rambler bus, the 222 runs in a circular route from Arundel station around the West Sussex region, stopping anywhere on demand. It only runs on sundays and bank holidays.
